Clients with alcohol withdrawal syndrome may have distorted sense of reality and may exhibit disorientation to time, place, person, or situation. Therefore, the priority nursing intervention is to provide environmental safety by adjusting the bed in the lowest possible position, placing call light within reach, removing articles that can injure the client, and instructing the significant other to stay with the client. Restraining the client should be considered as the last resort when all possible means are ineffective. The client is already exhibiting signs of altered mental status, therefore, further assessments are not necessary.
